item.title: Ticket #137 (Comments feed modification time is based on posts, not comments) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Is anyone doing anything with this? It's been two months since the last post, and that was me reporting that the fix suggested here had been working fine on my site for the previous several weeks.

Without this fix, no one will see updates to the comments feed until you post a new article.

item.title: Ticket #284 (No support for pingback.extensions.getPingbacks() in XML-RPC) created
item.dc:creator: Andreas
item.description:
There is no support for the pingback.extensions.getPingbacks() method in Wordpress. This method is not in the pingback specification, but it's still useful.

The method takes an url as argument and returns an array of urls that have pingbacked. By supporting this method it would be possible to retrieve a list of pingbacks to any url from a different server. Personally I would use this to create automatic playlists of entries with video or audio content.

The method is described at: â€‹http://simon.incutio.com/archive/2002/09/13/pingbackSupportedAgain

Please delete this if feature requests are considered rude in this system. I was advised to post here on the #wordpress channel.

item.title: Ticket #283 (Database Error on "Manage" -> Pages) updated

item.description: you can see same error in "Posts" in Admin area.

item.title: Ticket #283 (Database Error on "Manage" -> Pages) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Warning: join(): Bad arguments. in /usr/www/users/dario77/grassegger.at/wp1.3/wp-admin/edit.php on line 13

I just installed the lastest build: wordpress-2004-09-14.zip then clicked on "Manage" and then of "Pages" and the error get displayed.

Database error: [You have an error in your SQL syntax. Check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near ')' at line 1] SELECT ID, post_title FROM wp_posts WHERE post_status = 'draft' AND post_author IN ()

item.description: Please do not file bugs for this kind of problem, unless the problem is already there with a default WP install. Use the support forums instead, since the bug tracker is not a support forum.

item.title: Ticket #282 ("Pages" get assigned attributes, that can only be changed via SQL) created
item.dc:creator: rq
item.description:
Currently, if you create static pages, they get assigned the Default category, post slug, date etc.

Well first, i would like to be able to change post slug, especially, as long as WP doesn't work with accented characters very well.

Second, WP should either NOT assign any category to posts, or let the user choose it.

item.title: Ticket #280 (Authorized user can't publish) created
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description: Only new users can publish new posts and only when the new_users_can_blog setting is set to allow new users to do so.

item.title: Ticket #279 (quicktags.js inserts wrong date into "ins", "del" and probably other ...) created
item.dc:creator: rq
item.description: The date, counted in quicktags.js, and used in < del>, < ins> and, probably, some other tags, is wrong by one month. That's because the month number returned by "Date()" starts with zero, not with one in javascript. WP assumes it starts with one.

item.title: Ticket #277 (Add a new profile option to disable QuickTags) created
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description:
My laptop has a broken pointing device, so I often find myseld using the Mozilla hot-keys to navigate. ALT-D is supposed to allow me to place my cursor in the location bar, but WordPress's QuickTags uses ALT-D to insert an ins tag with the current timestamp. This makes it extremely difficult to use WordPress in Mozilla with keyboard-only navigation.

I would like an option in the user profile to _disable_ QuickTags for that user account.

item.dc:creator: mlinksva
item.description: no trackback permalink in generated .htaccess

item.title: Ticket #275 (trackback tag not prependend to trackback comment_content) created
item.dc:creator: mlinksva
item.description:
So in comment display, Trackback isn't called out. Simple fix:

cvs diff wp-trackback.php

Index: wp-trackback.php =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/cafelog/wordpress/wp-trackback.php,v retrieving revision 1.19 diff -r1.19 wp-trackback.php 70c70 < $comment_content = "<strong>$title</strong>\n\n$excerpt"; ---

$comment_content = "<trackback /><strong>$title</strong>\n\n$excerpt";

81c81

item.title: Ticket #274 (sql in wp_new_comment() doesn't match local variables) updated
item.dc:creator: mlinksva
item.description:
Also, comment_type is currently not inserted. Not sure if that is acutally used. Anyway, this fixes it:

cvs diff functions-post.php

Index: functions-post.php =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/cafelog/wordpress/wp-includes/functions-post.php,v retrieving revision 1.9 diff -r1.9 functions-post.php 394c394 < (comment_post_ID, comment_author, comment_author_email, comment_author_url, comment_author_IP, comment_date, comment_date_gmt, comment_content, comment_approved, comment_agent) ---

(comment_post_ID, comment_author, comment_author_email, comment_author_url, comment_author_IP, comment_date, comment_date_gmt, comment_content, comment_approved, comment_agent, comment_type)

396c396 < ('$comment_post_ID', '$author', '$email', '$tb_url', '$user_ip', '$now', '$now_gmt', '$comment', '$approved', '$user_agent') ---

('$comment_post_id', '$comment_author', '$comment_author_email', '$comment_author_url', '$user_ip', '$now', '$now_gmt', '$comment_content', '$approved', '$user_agent', '$comment_type')

item.title: Ticket #273 (Calendar doesn't display current month...) updated
item.dc:creator: mvandewettering
item.description: Sorry, this was caused by an inadvertant capture of the global variable "$m" by a modification done by me in index.php. Still, I might gently prod the aesthetic and practical sensibilities of making a variable named simply $m a global variable. Not good.

item.title: Ticket #274 (sql in wp_new_comment() doesn't match local variables) created
item.dc:creator: mlinksva
item.description:
Inserts empty strings for post id and other columns. Result: trackbacks go into database with mostly empty data. Fix below

cvs diff functions-post.php

Index: functions-post.php =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/cafelog/wordpress/wp-includes/functions-post.php,v retrieving revision 1.9 diff -r1.9 functions-post.php 396c396 < ('$comment_post_ID', '$author', '$email', '$tb_url', '$user_ip', '$now', '$now_gmt', '$comment', '$approved', '$user_agent') ---

('$comment_post_id', '$comment_author', '$comment_author_email', '$comment_author_url', '$user_ip', '$now', '$now_gmt', '$comment_content', '$approved', '$user_agent')
